title: How can you intentionally have and resist experiences through inner child analysis?
first_phrase: In the previous part of the text, the author discussed the importance of intentionally creating and experiencing resistance, as well as recognizing oneself as the observer and creator of experiences. In this final part, the author focuses on applying these concepts to fantasizing, planning, and explaining behaviors. The author provides a series of questions to ask one's inner child in each scenario, and encourages intentional resistance and creation of experiences. Finally, the author discusses futurizing and the potential past experiences that may cause an individual to justify their behavior.

last_phrase: In conclusion, by following the steps of asking your inner child, intentionally resisting and having the experience, and noticing yourself as the observer/creator of the experience, you can gain insight into past events that may be projected into your future and intentionally work towards overcoming resistance and creating desired experiences. Writing down your answers can aid in your planning and understanding of yourself.
